p: Assuming that the norms inscribed into non-majoritarian bodies must be coherent with societal values for their decisions to be accepted (Landwehr and Klinnert 2015), different countries may well select different sets of experts and implement different decision-rules. In any case, however, institutional design needs to ensure ‘throughput legitimacy’ (Schmidt 2013) by ensuring transparency and accountability. Moreover, both the act of delegation and the design of expert bodies charged with recommendations must publicly be regarded as contestable and reversible. Non-majoritarian expert bodes can only have a legitimate role in democratic decision-making processes where they are subject to scrutiny from a critical public sphere.
